item.title: New version alpha-0.0.18
item.description:
A new version of the database has been published. It includes the following papers:

  • Aslanbay Guler B., Demirel Z. and Imamoglu E. (2023) Comparative Evaluation of Chemical Garden Growth Techniques. Langmuir.

  • Patel V. K. and Busupalli B. (2023) Light-modulated colour transformation in highly intertwined vertically growing silver tungstate tubes. Phys. Chem. Chem. Phys.

  • Testón-Martínez S., Huertas-Roldán T., Knoll P., Barge L. M., Sainz-Díaz I. and Cartwright J. (2023) A microfluidic labyrinth self-assembled by a chemical garden. Phys. Chem. Chem. Phys.

item.title: New version alpha-0.0.17
item.description:
A new version of the database has been published. It includes the following paper:

  • Schuszter G., Balog E. and Bene K. (2023) Synthesis and composition modification of precipitate tubes in a confined flow reactor. Phys. Chem. Chem. Phys. https://doi.org/10.1039/D3CP03467D

item.title: New version alpha-0.0.16b
item.description:
A new version of the database has been published. It includes the following paper:

  • Helmbrecht V., Weingart M., Klein F., Braun D. and Orsi W. D. (2023) White and green rust chimneys accumulate RNA in a ferruginous chemical garden. Geobiology. https://doi.org/10.1111/gbi.12572

To avoid creating a new DOI with each published article, from now on the Zotero database will be updated when there are a certain number of articles or a certain amount of time has passed since the last update.

item.title: New version alpha-0.0.16
item.description:
A new version of the database has been published. It includes the following papers:

  • Holler S., Bartlett S., Löffler R. J. G., Casiraghi F., Diaz C. I. S., Cartwright J. H. E. and Hanczyc M. M. (2023) Hybrid organic–inorganic structures trigger the formation of primitive cell-like compartments. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences 120, e2300491120. https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.2300491120

  • Nogueira J., Batista B., Cooper M. and Steinbock O. Nonclassical Crystallization Causes Dendritic and Band-like Microscale Patterns in Inorganic Precipitates. Angewandte Chemie International Edition, e202306885. https://doi.org/10.1002/anie.202306885

item.title: New version alpha-0.0.15
item.description:
A new version of the database has been published. It includes the following paper:

  • Omran A., Gonzalez A., Salvan C., Gaylor M., Wang J., Leszczynski J. and Feng T. (2023) Serpentinization-Associated Mineral Catalysis of the Protometabolic Formose System. Life 13, 1297. https://doi.org/10.3390/life13061297

In addition, the following paper has been also added to the “theoretical” zotero folder:

  • Batista B. C., Morris A. Z. and Steinbock O. (2023) Pattern selection by material aging: Modeling chemical gardens in two and three dimensions. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences 120, e2305172120. https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.2305172120
